subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Revenue-Based Financing: Borrow Against Your Future
description: A short lesson to help you apply Revenue-Based Financing: Borrow Against Your Future.

hook.text: A SaaS startup needs $500K but doesn't want to give up equity. They repay from future revenue instead.

buildup.text: Revenue-based financing gives you capital now in exchange for a percentage of monthly revenue until repaid.

discovery.text: No equity lost, no board seats given. You repay 1.3-2x the original amount from monthly revenue.

twist.text: If revenue drops, payments shrink. If revenue grows, you pay back faster. The loan breathes with you.

climax.text: Companies like Clearco and Pipe made this model mainstream for e-commerce and SaaS businesses.

punchline.text: Borrow against tomorrow's revenue, keep today's equity.

quiz.question: How does revenue-based financing differ from venture capital?
